Contradict fact: The claim contradicts the fact that the Obama administration took several steps to address policing issues.
Exaggerate: The claim exaggerates by stating that Obama and Biden "never even tried to fix" policing issues, when in fact they did take action.
Understate: The claim understates the efforts made by the Obama administration to address policing issues.
Falters at times: The claim falters by ignoring the initiatives and reforms implemented by the Obama administration.
Lack enough support: The claim lacks enough support as it fails to acknowledge the measures taken by the Obama administration to address policing issues.
Problematic assumption: The claim makes a problematic assumption that Obama and Biden did nothing to fix policing issues.
Exist alternative explanation: The claim ignores the alternative explanation that the Trump administration disagreed with some of the Obama administration's measures and attempted to undo the progress made.
